title: Hargreaves Lansdown boosts customer numbers despite Woodford fallout
text:
Hargreaves Lansdown shrugged off any reputational damage from its support for troubled investor Neil Woodford's funds by boosting customer numbers in the third quarter.

The investment platform added a total of 35,000 customers net in the three months to September and grew assets under administration 3pc from the end of June to £101.8bn.

Net revenue rose 6pc against the same period in 2018, reaching £128m.

But the FTSE 100 company warned it had "seen new business in the period being impacted by weak investor sentiment arising from continuing Brexit and political uncertainty in the UK and wider global macro issues such as trade tariffs".
